description: Joseph Cornell began making boxes in tribute to ballet in 1940. Inscribed in the lid here is the legend of ballerina Marie Taglioni's encounter with a Russian highwayman who blackmailed her into dancing on rugs spread over a muddy road. The story became entangled in Cornell’s mind with seeing a load of ice spill from a truck at New York’s Grand Central Station, which, he said, “evoked in the most graphic manner the faerie of the Romantic ballet.”
title: Homage to the Romantic Ballet
